0015e9cd-cb6d-4272-9d3d-0498f270d839: A blight druid may not bond with an animal companion, but may select from the Death and Destruction domains in addition to those normally available.
ee90e7dc-9187-4e99-8ee4-da70a2690d41: A blizzard servant can transform itself into a whirlwind and back again. A creature in whirlwind form cannot make its normal {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} and does not {g|Encyclopedia:Threatened_Area}threaten{/g} the area around it. Creatures caught in the whirlwind take a –4 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} and a –2 penalty on attack rolls and must succeed on a {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration check{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 15 + {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} level) to cast a spell. An affected creature must succeed on a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} (DC 10 + half the blizzard servant's level + its {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} modifier) each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} or take {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} as if it were hit by the blizzard servant's spike attack.
9cbceb5c-64b3-4fed-8049-f63243f1367b:
A defender of the true world gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} against fey.
A defender of the true world can channel stored {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} energy into summoning spells that she hasn't prepared ahead of time, but she cannot use summon nature's ally to summon fey creatures. She can "lose" a prepared spell of 7th or lower level in order to cast any summon nature's ally spell of the same level or lower. She can "lose" a prepared spell of 8th level to cast summon elder earth elemental or "lose" a prepared spell of 9th level to cast summon elder worm.
c17ddf0a-8d25-4382-a09a-a3c4e624164b:
A druid can call upon nature's strength, granting her additional combat prowess. At 1st level, a druid can rampage for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to 4 + her {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier. For each level after 1st she possesses, the druid can rampage for 2 additional rounds per day.
While rampaging, a druid gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} made with {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural weapons{/g}. In addition, she takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}Armor Class{/g}. These bonuses are increased by 1 at 6th level and every 5 levels after.
8f7573fc-82a4-4769-85ef-997c1de8182c: A druid can channel stored {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} energy into summoning spells that she hasn't prepared ahead of time. She can "lose" a prepared spell in order to cast any summon nature's ally spell of the same level or lower.
1a30b5fd-f2bf-466a-9b42-d8544c151827: A druid can form a tight bond to an animal to gain an animal companion who can wear barding and advance along with the druid. Alternatively, they can form a bond with a domain to get {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and abilities it provides.
3fae1977-8d9b-43ef-89f6-bed5f51eef44: A druid gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Nature}Lore (nature){/g} checks.
228b1da7-964c-4de8-97cf-89b3bd91a077: A druid gains the ability to transform into an animal, gaining its {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} and abilities, thus becoming deadly in melee combat. As a druid advances, they learn to turn into more and more powerful beasts.
068e28c4-f056-415e-858c-26281086223e: A druid who changes to a prohibited {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g} loses all {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and druid abilities (including her animal companion, but not including weapon, armor, and shield proficiencies). She cannot thereafter gain levels as a druid until she returns to a permitted alignment.
f3eb616b-fa37-45fe-b565-d71b0ca6dce5:
A primal druid adds {g|SpellsEnlargePerson}enlarge person{/g} to her list of class {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}.
She can also channel stored spell energy to cast this spell without preparing it—she can lose a prepared spell of 1st level or higher to cast enlarge person.
At 8th level, if a primal druid casts enlarge person on himself, he gains +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} instead of the usual bonuses.
At 16th level, if a primal druid casts enlarge person on himself, he increases by two size categories and gains +6 size bonus to Strength and Constitution instead of the usual bonuses.
3d14074a-0a3d-42ab-ae27-bda0ab082675: All creatures summoned by the winter child gain cold {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} 5. At 10th level, this resistance increases to 10, and the creatures gain the effects of the blink {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}. At 15th level, this resistance increases to 15, and the creatures' {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} deal an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g}. A winter child cannot summon fire elementals.
8c69064b-01f1-4347-8161-4251c7343444: At 10th level, all creatures summoned by the winter child gain cold {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} 10 and the effects of the blink {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}.
37c22017-f66e-4ede-acd5-2f6b23d71b66: At 10th level, the drovier can choose to grant her allies the benefits of the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} {g|SpellsAspectOfTheBear}aspect of the bear{/g} instead of an {g|SpellsAnimalAspect}animal aspect{/g}.
900a384a-80d9-431b-b618-6d35cb87ad49:
At 11th level, a winter child strengthens the bond between her and her companion, imbuing it with her own power. Her blizzard servant gains the following benefits:
Large {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g}, +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, +2 bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, +2 natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 5/-, and cold {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} 20. In addition, its whirlwind of hail ability no longer affects allies. If the Winter Child already has an animal companion, it only receives half the bonuses and does not increase in size.
fe7dff5a-644b-4fa9-9255-94dfe2436d19: At 12th level, the drovier can choose to grant her allies the benefits of the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} {g|SpellsAspectOfTheStag}aspect of the stag{/g} instead of an {g|SpellsAnimalAspect}animal aspect{/g}.
92ef2707-3f20-46ec-a290-a04c81f729a5: At 14th level, the drovier can choose to grant her allies the benefits of the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} {g|SpellsAspectOfTheWolf}aspect of the wolf{/g} rather than an {g|SpellsAnimalAspect}animal aspect{/g}.
8fea6db0-0df4-4dc9-b4ef-49b2e1718ede: At 15th level, all creatures summoned by the winter child gain cold {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} 15, and their {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} deal an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g}.
a7beb77a-6988-41f0-b821-09040df9a6ae:
At 16th level, a winter child sacrifices a part of her soul to let a great blizzard spirit into the material world. Her blizzard servant gains the following benefits:
Huge {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g}, +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, +6 bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, +2 bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, +2 natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, the numbing cold ability, and cold {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} 30. If the Winter Child already has an animal companion, it only receives half the bonuses and does not increase in size. In addition, whenever an ally hits an enemy affected by the blizzard servant's whirlwind of hail ability, that enemy takes an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g}.
e69e1995-b43e-4489-9f0a-93bed9543366:
At 1st level, a druid forms a bond with nature. This bond can take one of two forms. The first is a close tie to the natural world, granting the druid one of the following cleric domains: Air, Animal, Earth, Fire, Plant, Water, or Weather. When determining the powers and bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} granted by this domain, the druid's effective cleric level is equal to her druid level. A druid that selects this option also receives additional domain spell slots, just like a cleric. She must prepare the spell from her domain in this slot and this spell cannot be used to cast a spell spontaneously.
The second option is to form a close bond with an animal companion. Unlike normal animals of its kind, an animal companion's {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g}, abilities, {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} advance as the druid advances in level. If a character receives an animal companion from more than one source, her effective druid levels stack for the purposes of determining the statistics and abilities of the companion. Most animal companions increase in {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} when their druid reaches 4th or 7th level, depending on the companion.
d0e26ec1-843b-483a-b58d-8df19996abc5:
At 1st level, a feyspeaker allows the strange idylls of the fey to guide her magic. The feyspeaker uses her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} score instead of her {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} score as her key {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellcasting{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g} (to determine her spell {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DCs{/g}, bonus spells per day, {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration checks{/g}, and so on).
At 4th, 6th, 8th, 10th, 12th, 14th, 16th, and 18th levels, a feyspeaker adds one Enchantment or Illusion spell from the sorcerer/wizard spell list to her druid spell list as a spell of 1 level higher (for instance, at 4th level, she could add {g|SpellsColorSpray}color spray{/g} as a 2nd-level druid spell). In order to select a spell, she must be of a level high enough (including the increased spell level) to cast it. Once selected, the spell cannot be changed.
6b1419db-a051-450f-b394-6cb9ba0bf188: At 1st level, a winter child must select the ice subdomain when choosing a domain. This replaces nature bond.
9d58b4bd-3302-4923-8a1c-3aaa370e1eb2: At 1st level, an elemental rampager gains a claw {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} that deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} (for {g|Encyclopedia:Size}medium{/g} creature). At 9th level, the damage of his claw increases to 1d8, and at at 15th level, it increases to 1d10.
4db078a5-f3fb-48df-b47a-3f4150eee398: At 20th level, a winter child gains the elemental subtype and {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Immunity}immunity{/g} to cold. She is also considered a native outsider when determining the effects of any {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like abilities{/g}. Lastly, the winter child becomes airborne, which grants her immunity to ground-based effects and trip.
a099b5c8-82ef-4198-b96e-3a1a82233fe1: At 20th level, an elemental rampager become immune to his chosen energy type.
12ccc7d2-5614-484e-a401-887201732786: At 20th level, the drovier can use this ability at will.
be175314-4bdd-4c95-9381-aac313f51972: At 2nd level, you can move through any sort difficult terrain at your normal {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} and without taking {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} or suffering any other impairment.
164a7e03-b8d9-4568-b004-1854c58eeb23: At 3rd level, the defender of the true world's animal companion and any creatures she summons with summon nature's ally gain a +1 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} against fey creatures. This bonus increases to +2 at 8th level, +3 at 13th level, and +4 at 18th level.
9aa05bbf-db52-43dc-a9c1-7342fa6c3b25: At 4th level, a drovier can imbue her allies (including herself ) with an aspect of a wild animal. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, she chooses an animal totem and grants the abilities of that totem to every ally within 30 feet. This otherwise functions like the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} {g|SpellsAnimalAspect}animal aspect{/g}. She can use this ability for 10 minutes per druid level each day. This duration does not need to be consecutive, but it must be used in 10-minute increments. If she uses the ability to grant a new aspect, any previous aspect immediately ends.
a376c6d8-3eb5-414d-bdd8-521f44cd9b8b:
At 4th level, a drovier can imbue her allies (including herself ) with an aspect of a wild animal. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, she chooses an animal totem and grants the abilities of that totem to every ally within 30 feet. This otherwise functions like the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} {g|SpellsAnimalAspect}animal aspect{/g}. She can use this ability for 10 minutes per druid level each day. This duration does not need to be consecutive, but it must be used in 10-minute increments. If she uses the ability to grant a new aspect, any previous aspect immediately ends.
At 6th level, the drovier's communal aspect ability grants the benefits of the spell {g|SpellsGreaterAnimalAspect}greater animal aspect{/g}.
At 8th level, the drovier can choose to grant her allies the benefits of the spell {g|SpellsAspectOfTheFalcon}aspect of the falcon{/g} instead of an animal aspect.
At 10th level, the drovier can choose to grant her allies the benefits of the spell {g|SpellsAspectOfTheBear}aspect of the bear{/g} instead of an animal aspect.
At 12th level, the drovier can choose to grant her allies the benefits of the spell {g|SpellsAspectOfTheStag}aspect of the stag{/g} instead of an animal aspect.
At 14th level, the drovier can choose to grant her allies the benefits of the spell {g|SpellsAspectOfTheWolf}aspect of the wolf{/g} rather than an animal aspect.
At 20th level, the drovier can use this ability at will.
This replaces wild shape.
1f0d09b5-a0a8-4eb5-903f-71d72104cf59:
At 4th level, a druid gains the ability to turn herself into a wolf and back again once per day. The effect lasts for 1 hour per druid level, or until she changes back.
Changing form is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} and doesn't provoke an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}. A druid can use this ability an additional time per day at 6th level and every two levels thereafter, for a total of eight times at 18th level.
At 6th level, a druid can use wild shape to change into a leopard or a small elemental. At 8th level, a druid can use wild shape to change into a bear or a medium elemental. At 10th level, a druid can use wild shape to change into a smilodon, a shambling mound, or a large elemental. At 12th level, a druid can use wild shape to change into a huge elemental.
For the feyspeaker archetype, all level prerequisites are increased by 2.
d65b4ca6-28d1-4bcd-b80b-ad9c9afb4260:
At 4th level, a winter child forms a bond with a blizzard elemental. This ability functions like the druid's animal companion ability, except that the winter child's effective druid level is equal to her druid level –3 and she can only select a blizzard elemental as her companion. 
This replaces wild shape.
2ef3e558-4de9-4e71-8721-28c115a7f795:
At 4th level, a winter child gains cold {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} 5. At 8th level and every 4 levels thereafter, this resistance increases by 5. The winter child also becomes immune to being dazzled.
This replaces resist nature's lure.
87f41e9e-f4ab-4ae8-a746-dc4f7412edf4: At 4th level, an elemental rampager selects one element. He gains a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} with {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attacks{/g} while rampaging, energy {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} to the chosen element and other bonuses, depending on the selected element.
79d4c03f-99f2-4411-b7bb-09cfdeaf6a3c: At 4th level, you gain energy {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} 5 against the chosen element. At 9th level it increases to 10, at 15th level to 20.
f6381c09-0ced-483d-8c1f-c6a355248629:
At 6th level, a winter child strengthens the bond between her and her companion, imbuing it with her own power. Her blizzard servant gains the following benefits:
Medium {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g}, +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, +4 bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, +2 bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, and cold {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} 10. If the Winter Child already has an animal companion, it only receives half the bonuses and does not increase in size.
0d1c4e71-d6a7-4474-a8d2-38966ba0db87: At 6th level, the drovier's communal aspect ability grants the benefits of the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} {g|SpellsGreaterAnimalAspect}greater animal aspect{/g}.
88182c5c-eb07-4174-b381-447aa0462864: At 8th level, the drovier can choose to grant her allies the benefits of the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} {g|SpellsAspectOfTheFalcon}aspect of the falcon{/g} instead of an {g|SpellsAnimalAspect}animal aspect{/g}.
ff798279-a4a7-4eea-ba49-68918185bd9d: At 9th level, a blight druid gains immunity to all diseases, including natural and supernatural diseases. She also becomes immune to effects that would cause her to become {g|ConditionSickened}sickened{/g} or {g|ConditionNauseated}nauseated{/g}.
d32ee06a-3160-4754-a17a-251668baec6b: At 9th level, a defender of the true world becomes immune to the mind-affecting effects of fey.
de8039ab-c330-4edd-bf0f-62b6571e3668: At 9th level, a druid gains immunity to all poisons.
9fe8e7f2-a43d-4d60-97b6-1decbf18ca6f: At 9th level, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, a winter child can change the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}damage type{/g} of her {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} to cold. In addition, she can see normally inside the area of the {g|SpellsIceStorm}ice storm{/g} spell or in similar natural snowstorms.
19a6f483-d0f1-4f60-b800-f0cb2f126ec0: Call a Feast — Cover of Snow
9c4a3cb3-a0ca-4d27-a61b-68ebf4b2690e: Droviers view their allies and adventuring companions as a herd or pack to be protected and directed, with variations on that theme ranging from culture to culture.
cec8ec77-9614-4351-a06d-7f18087ff35e: Druids are guardians of balance, nature, and elements. They have access to the most powerful divine magic, coming from their connection with the natural world. In a battle, druids can empower their allies and animal companions, summon creatures to aid them, or control and weaken enemies.
6af24ab1-409f-4842-945b-cba0a4510d8e:
Druids are proficient with the following weapons: club, dagger, dart, quarterstaff, scimitar, scythe, sickle, shortspear, sling, and spear. They are also proficient with all {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attacks{/g} (claw, bite, and so forth) of any form they assume with wild shape.
Druids are proficient with light and medium armor but are prohibited from wearing metal armor; thus, they may wear only padded, leather, or hide armor. A druid may also wear wooden armor that has been altered by the ironwood {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} so that it functions as though it were steel. Druids are proficient with shields (except tower shields) but must use only wooden ones.
0234e51e-6d9f-4b16-913b-647795bc9616: Druids can cast a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Cantrips_Orisons}orisons{/g}, or 0-level {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. These spells are cast like any other spell, but they are not expended when cast and may be used again.
56dfd807-0fb3-4b35-a726-aae2f217ef05: During elemental rampage, your {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attacks{/g} deal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} of the chosen element, increasing to 2d6 at 11th level, and 3d6 at 20th level.
32c9f07f-175a-4616-a1b4-3391cd4c6916: Every time a druid {g|Encyclopedia:Rest}rests{/g}, they prepare a limited number of {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. A druid can spend a prepared spell to cast a summoning spell instead.
6b5afe40-d9b2-4a50-a8f7-abf24aad8efc: Primal druids hone their spiritual and magical connections to nature's largest creatures, especially dinosaurs and megafauna, revering these massive creatures as living relics of a primeval time when all creatures were more in harmony with nature.
b3f7ebb2-9afc-4c99-941e-9fedc3b5521a: Some druids embrace the destructive aspect of nature and its elements, using this power to fuel their prowess in melee combat.
97a36f16-1402-48cc-b5ed-a48e9849c167: Some druids hear the whispers of the natural world like fey creatures do, and learn to mimic those tantalizing murmurs in order to influence the minds of both wild beasts and civilized people. These feyspeakers are often touched by the fey in some way, such as mortals who dared to eat the food and drink the wine while in the hidden halls of the fey.
10f1d5da-e831-44a0-930d-5704fe0efc2d: Some druids specialize in tracking down, diverting, and slaying fey threats.
a754db42-1670-4870-849f-f68a0d81f233: Sometimes children born in the darkest hour of winter take on a strange kinship with the blizzard that witnessed their birth. Over time, this connection is strengthened, and the winter child becomes a true master of snow and ice.
440dca9b-7f83-412d-a2da-666f1e8a7edb: Starting at 11th level, every time you {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} an enemy with your {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attacks{/g} during elemental rampage, the enemy must make a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 10 + half the druid level + {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier), or become {g|ConditionEntangled}entangled{/g}, until a new successful saving throw is made.
8201d877-59d0-4a33-9d58-9f1fdfb844db: Starting at 11th level, every time you {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} an enemy with your {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attacks{/g} during elemental rampage, the enemy must make a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 10 + half the druid level + {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier), or become {g|ConditionSickened}sickened{/g}, until a new successful saving throw is made.
d7ae215b-c8ab-47e6-b3a9-4cdfc897e0dd: Starting at 11th level, every time you {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} an enemy with your {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attacks{/g} during elemental rampage, the enemy must make a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 10 + half the druid level + {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier), or start burning, receiving {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
70c9119b-caa2-4438-a7dd-9dfdff9fe61c: Starting at 11th level, every time you {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} an enemy with your {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attacks{/g} during elemental rampage, you deal your additional elemental {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to two more enemies within 15 feet.
2464fde5-7ee6-4842-a09e-d4e7a9e59ad7: Starting at 13th level, any creature that strikes a blight druid with a {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed strike{/g}, or {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural weapon{/g} must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} with a {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of 10 + 1/2 the druid's level + the druid's {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier or become {g|ConditionNauseated}nauseated{/g} for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} and contract bubonic plague, as the {g|SpellsContagion}contagion{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}. If the creature makes its save, it is immune to this effect for 24 hours.
280524f7-7f41-4901-8c3f-b3cc70e28bc3: Starting at 20th level, enemies under effect of entangling cold make all enemies in a 5-foot radius make the same {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}, or become {g|ConditionEntangled}entangled{/g}.
e0d2c3b8-75b0-4b4b-8af1-504585add7d9: Starting at 20th level, enemies under effect of sickening acid make all enemies in a 5-foot radius make the same {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}, or become {g|ConditionSickened}sickened{/g}.
b6ef00fe-4daf-4546-99e3-0c3889f7fcdd: Starting at 20th level, enemies who are burning because of your elemental rampage deal the burn {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to all enemies in a 5-foot radius around them.
f6182f4f-3991-405c-9614-1ea3414f63b4: Starting at 20th level, every time you {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} an enemy with your {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attacks{/g} during elemental rampage, you deal your additional elemental {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to four more enemies within 15 feet.
e476fa70-60a6-4898-a4db-807142678c7e: Starting at 4th level, a defender of the true world gains a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against the spell-like and {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}supernatural abilities{/g} of fey. She treats her {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attacks{/g} as cold iron for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}, and she gains a +2 bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} to overcome the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} of fey creatures.
2498836e-daca-41fc-8fcb-4244daf951db: Starting at 4th level, a druid gains a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against the spell-like and {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}supernatural abilities{/g} of fey and plants.
2c3c1aaf-aa75-4467-9875-896efd074a1f: Starting at 5th level, if a blight druid is adjacent to a creature at the beginning of its turn, the creature must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} with a {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of 10 + 1/2 the druid's level + the druid's {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier or become {g|ConditionSickened}sickened{/g} for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. A creature of the animal, fey, or plant type that fails its save is {g|ConditionNauseated}nauseated{/g} for 1 round and sickened for 1 minute thereafter. If the creature makes its save, it is immune to this effect for 24 hours, as are creatures immune to disease.
a3326005-9f4f-48c5-9727-e810aa1f9cd1: The devoted servants of nature corrupted, ruined, and destroyed, blight druids are the caretakers of lands ravaged by natural disaster. While some are devoted to reforming and reclaiming lands despoiled by the ravages of civilization, others seek out the more rapacious violence inherent in nature and feed the creeping rot and decay that brings an end to all things.
5d12faa6-2aa6-4777-9807-662207984f5b: Their close tie to the natural world grants the druid one of the following cleric domains: Air, Animal, Earth, Fire, Ice subdomain, Plant, Water, or Weather. When determining the powers and bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} granted by this domain, the druid's effective cleric level is equal to her druid level. A druid that selects this option also receives additional domain spell slots, just like a cleric. She must prepare the spell from her domain in this slot and this spell cannot be used to cast a spell spontaneously.
d9fea9d9-a09c-4673-b2cd-49ab7764b30a: This creature is freezing and takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g} each turn.
d2f0bfa7-9120-4561-8b9e-727eb254f168: This creature is freezing and takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g} each turn.
41c6686f-4616-4c34-80ca-3b846a663331: This creature is freezing and takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g} each turn.
3f639e74-d1d4-428a-9ef7-af865837e687: This creature is freezing and takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g} each turn.
e48195e6-6407-4cab-a677-f649dea7cb6f: This creature is freezing and takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g} each turn.
1ed0c617-6d32-40ab-93d8-d096f56d2c2c: This creature is on fire and takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} each turn.
9a7b28ac-b966-4fff-8557-5558fd15a91f: This creature is on fire and takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} each turn.
32e5ada2-6259-40c5-b658-f0a626c2e613: This creature is on fire and takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} each turn.
1125dee9-2e56-4c64-846f-47b3c4889dae: This creature is on fire and takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} each turn.
7bbd0239-1220-49b0-9666-ddf76e5cef88: Whenever the blizzard elemental deals {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g} to a creature, that creature must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude saving throw{/g} or be {g|ConditionStaggered}staggered{/g} for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. The save {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} is {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}-based.
7395ec71-69b7-4477-9d38-6c76fcff8df8: While some druids might keep to the fringe of battle, allowing companions and summoned creatures to fight while they confound foes with the powers of nature, others transform into deadly beasts and savagely wade into combat. Druids worship personifications of elemental forces, natural powers, or nature itself. Typically this means devotion to a nature deity, though druids are just as likely to revere vague spirits, animalistic demigods, or even specific awe-inspiring natural wonders.
d545a1cc-bc7c-434c-b6d1-a33bd4120d87: You are in huge earth elemental form now. You have a +8 {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, a +4 size bonus to your {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, a +6 natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, and a +1 bonus to your {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuvers{/g}. You also have two {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d8{/g} slam attacks, {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resist{/g} acid 20, and {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Vulnerability}vulnerability{/g} to electricity. You are immune to {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g} and sneak attacks and have {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 5/—.
f88c6533-0ed9-49b2-b5ff-18283e0eee97: You can transform yourself into a whirlwind and back again. The whirlwind is 30 feet wide, and every creature that spends a {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} in the whirlwind must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} or take {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}bludgeoning damage{/g}. While in whirlwind form, you cannot {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}, but you are able to use your abilities.
13862c14-02a8-4bc5-b84e-c3ca7ae73bca: You can transform yourself into a whirlwind and back again. The whirlwind is 30 feet wide, and every creature that spends a {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} in the whirlwind must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} or take {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}bludgeoning damage{/g}. While in whirlwind form, you cannot {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}, but you are able to use your abilities.
670f1d65-c34a-4858-a267-7bbfd2f58afd: You can transform yourself into a whirlwind and back again. The whirlwind is 40 feet wide, and every creature that spends a {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} in the whirlwind must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} or take {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}bludgeoning damage{/g}. While in whirlwind form, you cannot {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}, but you are able to use your abilities.
e1cb713a-1387-4859-9eab-fa4888931807: You can transform yourself into whirlwind and back again. A whirlwind is 40 feet wide, and every creature that spends a {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} in the whirlwind must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} or take {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}bludgeoning damage{/g}. While in whirlwind form, you cannot {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}, but you are able to use your abilities.
